comments.body: Check the `rc` of this command to make sure it was good before parsing. You should probably do this on the previous commands as well.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +263,267 @@                # https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/50871
                args = [ip_path, 'addr', 'show', device]
                rc, data, stderr = self.module.run_command(args, errors='surrogate_then_replace')
                if rc == 0:
                    parse_ip_output(data)

comments.body: I'm going back and forth on this: Does defaulting `broadcast` above to `None` make more sense instead of `''` since it won't always exist? Then it would serialize to `null`, which is probably more semantically accurate.
Semantically it's probably more correct, but in practice, dealing with different types in playbooks is a pain. Keeping a consistent type is easier on playbook authors.
